description: Explores the history of human relationships with the environment on a global scale through analysis of long-term changes, from early civilizations, to the beginnings of global trade, the Industrial Revolution, urbanization, and 20th century technological developments. Offers first-hand historiographical research experience and training in writing for public web audiences.

linked_requisite_text: Sophomore standing or 3 credits in HISTORY, GEOG or ENVIR ST
